rounds.observation:
[GAME] Welcome to the Tic Tac Toe Arena! You are competing as Player 0.
Victory is achieved by claiming three consecutive squares in any direction: horizontal, vertical, or diagonal.
To make your move, choose a numbered position (0-8) on the grid and submit it in brackets.
Example: '[7]' will claim the bottom-right corner of the board.

Your battle symbol is 'O', while your opponent fights with 'X'.

[GAME] Current Board:

 0 | 1 | 2 
---+---+---
 3 | 4 | 5 
---+---+---
 6 | 7 | 8 

Available Moves: '[0]', '[1]', '[2]', '[3]', '[4]', '[5]', '[6]', '[7]', '[8]'

rounds.response:
[Player 0] Now that my opponent has claimed the top-left corner (cell 0) with X, I'll take the bottom-right corner (cell 8) to create symmetry and block potential diagonal paths. This move denies their control over the opposite corner and maintains pressure across the board. By placing O at position 8, I also set up future options for winning lines in the bottom row (cells 6, 7, 8) or the second diagonal (cells 2, 4, 6). Additionally, it leaves my opponent with fewer strong positional opportunities.  

[8]
